thread.title: Professor moves student’s exam to accommodate Cubs playoff game
thread.title_full: Professor moves student’s exam to accommodate Cubs playoff game

author: Larry Brown
title: Professor moves student’s exam to accommodate Cubs playoff game
text:
Professor moves student’s exam to accommodate Cubs playoff game Larry Brown Sports 6 hrs ago Larry Brown © Dennis Wierzbicki-USA TODAY Sports Cubs fans are hoping that this is the year the break the World Series drought. The Chicago Cubs reached the playoffs this season for the first time since 2008, and they are hoping to win their first World Series since 1908. At least one college professor recognizes the significance of the team's pursuit.
AdChoices A Cubs fan named Ben Larson, who is a student at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, emailed one of his professors to see if the teacher could do him a big favor by moving a midterm exam scheduled for Thursday, Oct. 8. As Larson explained over email, he and his family scored tickets to the one-game playoff against the Pittsburgh Pirates and planned to drive to the game. With the game on Wednesday, he wouldn't be able to take a test Thursday.
Luckily the professor offered to come through for him:
@Cubs #onlyforthecubbies #OctoberBaseball #myprofessorgetsit pic.twitter.com/efCY6KznaO
— Ben Larson (@ben_larson6) October 3, 2015
Shoot, if we all had known our teachers would be this accommodating, how many of us would have tried to pull this maneuver?
We knew Cubs fans were loyal and sometimes a disgusting bunch , but one thing you cannot deny is their passion. This is awesome.
Go to MSN Home
